pages.text: There are various techniques how $(item)Ores$() can be extracted from the ground, these are described on the following pages.

pages.title: Cave Mining
pages.text: The classic way to mine. You can look for ores without mining a lot of $(item)Stone$(), but since some ores have reduced air exposure, the spawn chances are reduced a bit.

pages.title: Strip Mining
pages.text: Strip mining is the most efficient way to farm ores, many small corridors are created next to each other in order to be able to cover the entire area.

pages.title: Tunnel Mining
pages.text: Is often used if you want to travel underground in a certain direction anyway or tunnel systems are to be created.

pages.title: Shaft Mining
pages.text: Is used to create a shaft to a certain height, ores from different levels are be covered.

pages.title: Quarry Mining
pages.text: This variant is not particularly efficient, but covers the entire area with all resources, is often used with $(thing)Mods$() that contain $(item)Quarrys$().

pages.title: Explosion Mining
pages.text: Mining with explosives is mainly used in conjunction with $(item)Ancient Debris$(), since it's pretty much the fastest option in the $(thing)Nether$() using exploding $(item)Beds$().
But $(item)TNT$() or $(thing)Flying Machines$() are also used.
